data.title: Linnemann Funeral Homes
data.meta_description: Let Linnemann Funeral Homes ease the pain of your suffering. Call our funeral home today in Boone County for more info about our services. (859) 727-1250
data.text:
A memorial Mass for Denise will be held on September 6, 2024 at Mary Queen of Heaven Church in Erlanger, Kentucky at 11:00am. Obituary details are pending at this time.

View More

Steven Mark Abbott, 61, of Independence, KY, passed away peacefully on Tuesday, August 27, 2024, at Hospice Care of St. Elizabeth in Edgewood, KY. Steve was Executive Director at Cincinnati Cancer Advisors for four years and graduated from Holmes High School and Northern Kentucky University. Steve was a passionate advocate for patients diagnosed with cancer.…

View More

Sr. M. Denise Gough, OSB died peacefully on Sunday, August 25 at St. Walburg Monastery at the age of 95. A Benedictine sister for 70 years, Sr. Denise served as a registered nurse and nurse anesthetist at Mt. Mary Hospital, Hazard, KY; St. Joseph Hospital, Florence CO; Madonna Manor, Villa Hills, KY and St. Clair…

View More

James “Tim” McKinley, 86 of Erlanger, a cherished husband, father, and grandfather, passed away peacefully on August 24, 2024, surrounded by his family. Tim was a devout Catholic and graduated from St. Henry High School in 1956, where he laid the foundation for a life characterized by dedication and leadership. As a longtime member of…

View More

Lucille Smalley, 92, of Independence, KY, passed away peacefully on Friday, August 23, 2024, at Boonespring Rehabilitation in Union, KY. Lucille was known for her caring nature and generous spirit. She spent many years working as an assembly line technician for Crous-Hinds before transitioning to a fulfilling role as a nanny for a decade, where…

View More

Ammon, Shirley , 96, of Burlington, KY, passed away peacefully on August 20, 2024. Born in Hebron, KY, Shirley lived a full and vibrant life, touching many with her warmth and kindness. She was preceded in death by her beloved husband, Richard Ammon, and her granddaughter, Meghan Elizabeth Ammon. Shirley is survived by her devoted…

View More

Dorothy “Dottie” Nugent, 93, of Lakeside Park, Kentucky, passed away peacefully on August 18, 2024. Born on May 22, 1931, her life was a testament to dedication, love, and joy. An avid gardener, she took great pride in cultivating her beautiful garden. Dottie also had a passion for traveling, eagerly exploring new places and creating…

View More

Jay Dee Bond Sr., age 85, passed away peacefully on August 18, 2024. He is now reunited with his beloved wife of 64 years, Mary Lou, in heaven. He served in the United States Army and was stationed at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. He went on to work with American Airlines before starting his own business,…

View More

Keith Alan Jayne, 62, passed away Tuesday August 13, 2024 at St Elizabeth Medical Center in Edgewood, KY. He was an A&P Mechanic with General Electric for the past 13 years. Preceded in death by his parents Fredrick and Shirley Jayne (nee Paugh) and brother David and James Jayne. Survivors include his wife Elizabeth Jayne,…

View More

Eric Cronin of Elsemere, Kentucky, a beloved son, brother, uncle and friend, passed away on August 12th, 2024, at the age of 38. Eric was a naturally charismatic storyteller, gifted with a great, and somewhat twisted, sense of humor. He loved to make everyone in a room laugh and will be remembered most for his…

View More

DIXON, Patricia May, 64, of Loveland, Ohio, passed away on August 11, 2024. Born on December 30, 1959, in Ft. Thomas, KY, she was predeceased by her father, Melvin Meyers. She is survived by her mother, Margaret Meyers; her sister, Joyce Coots (Dave); her brother, Thomas Meyers (Tracy); nephew, Tyler Meyers; and niece, Madison Meyers.…

View More

Terence “Terry” A. Nyquist, 65, passed away peacefully on Friday, August 9, 2024, at Boonespring in Union, KY. He was a graduate of the University of North Dakota. With a career spanning over 40 years, Terry began his journey as an airline pilot with Comair, later flew with US Air, and ultimately retired from American…

View More

Brenda Sue Kramer, 69, of Sun City Center, Florida, passed away on August 8, 2024. She was born to the late Loraine and Bud Brautigan on September 21, 1954 in Covington, Kentucky. Brenda earned her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Northern Kentucky University and furthered her education with a Master’s degree in Rehabilitation Counseling…

View More

Mary Elizabeth McIntosh (nee, Smith), 79, of Florence, KY, passed away peacefully on Thursday, August 8, 2024, at St. Elizabeth Healthcare in Florence. Mary was a dedicated homemaker who devoted over 60 years to caring for children, leaving a lasting impact on many lives. She found joy in watching her favorite soap operas and was…

View More

Urszula Barczak was more than a mom, sister, grandma, great grandma, aunt, friend and nurse; she was a child of God who lived her faith in all she did. She was a living example of how to be Christ to one another. She dedicated her life to her family and to nursing, literally keeping her…
